e4: Adopting the new policy enhances transparency and honesty in financial reporting, aligning with ethical best practices and possibly boosting long-term investor trust. Although it may cause initial confusion among some investors, clear communication and education could mitigate these issues, reducing the risk of legal complications and promoting a more equitable trading environment.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness in disclosing financial information. It should aim to provide all investors, regardless of their sophistication, with an honest view of the company's financial performance. Relevant considerations might include the method of communicating changes in reporting practices to ensure investors are not misled and maintaining compliance with regulatory standards to foster trust and avoid legal repercussions.
e6: How will the management plan to communicate the change in the reporting policy to ensure all investors understand it clearly? Additionally, what measures are in place to monitor investor reactions and address any misinterpretations or adverse responses following the policy shift?
